BackCBShrug.name: Cable Shrug
BackCBShrug.preparation: Stand facing low pulley and grasp cable bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Stand close to pulley.
BackCBShrug.execution: With arms straight, elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
BackCBShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

BackCBBarShrug.name: Cable Bar Shrug
BackCBBarShrug.preparation: Position adjustable pulleys at low position. Stand close to cable bar and grasp with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip.
BackCBBarShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
BackCBBarShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate, depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

BackCBShrugDualPulley.name: Cable Shrug (dual pulley)
BackCBShrugDualPulley.preparation: Stand between two low pulleys and grasp stirrups to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to each side.
BackCBShrugDualPulley.execution: With arms straight, elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
BackCBShrugDualPulley.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

BackCBShrugStirrups.name: Cable Shrug (with stirrups)
BackCBShrugStirrups.preparation: Stand between two low pulleys and grasp stirrups to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to each side.
BackCBShrugStirrups.execution: With arms straight, elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
BackCBShrugStirrups.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

BackCBOneArmShrug.name: Cable One Arm Shrug
BackCBOneArmShrug.preparation: Grasp stirrup with one hand and stand close to low pulley to side.
BackCBOneArmShrug.execution: With arms straight, elevate shoulder as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
BackCBOneArmShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.
